content.question: The distribution of the number of moths captured per night by a certain moth trap is approximately normal with mean 103. If 28 percent of the captures fall below 76 per night, which of the following equations can be used to find <math alttext="sigma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the standard deviation of the distribution?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.28 equals the fraction 103 minus 76, over sigma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.28</mn><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>103</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>76</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.28 equals the fraction 76 minus 103, over sigma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.28</mn><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>76</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>103</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 0.58 equals the fraction 103 minus 76, over sigma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.58</mn><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>103</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>76</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 0.58 equals the fraction 76 minus 103, over sigma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.58</mn><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>76</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>103</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.58 equals the fraction 76 minus 103, over sigma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.58</mn><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>76</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>103</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="negative 0.58 equals the fraction 76 minus 103, over sigma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.58</mn><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>76</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>103</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
